results.title: AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce ...
results.content: # AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce Physician Burnout Gains Traction Abridge, a startup that offers an AI note-taking tool for doctors, raised $300 million at a $5.3 billion valuation, according to The Wall Street Journal. Along with Abridge — which has now raised $757.5 million total from investors, per Crunchbase — other well-funded startups in the AI healthcare documentation space include: * Nabla, which has a note-taking AI copilot for doctors and other medical staff earlier this month raised $70 million in Series C funding, bringing its total raised to $114.7 million; Overall, funding to startups at the intersection of AI and healthcare hit $7.5 billion in 2024. * Rounds Raised By Startups Using AI, 2025

AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce ...
# AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce Physician Burnout Gains Traction Abridge, a startup that offers an AI note-taking tool for doctors, raised $300 million at a $5.3 billion valuation, according to The Wall Street Journal. Along with Abridge — which has now raised $757.5 million total from investors, per Crunchbase — other well-funded startups in the AI healthcare documentation space include: * Nabla, which has a note-taking AI copilot for doctors and other medical staff earlier this month raised $70 million in Series C funding, bringing its total raised to $114.7 million; Overall, funding to startups at the intersection of AI and healthcare hit $7.5 billion in 2024. * Rounds Raised By Startups Using AI, 2025

In July 2025, the company raised $243 million in Series C funding at a $1.25 billion valuation, bringing its total funding to 320 million as of September 2025.
